thread.title: Some on St. Louis' governing board to call for public vote on stadium funding
thread.title_full: Some on St. Louis' governing board to call for public vote on stadium funding

title: Some on St. Louis' governing board to call for public vote on stadium funding
text:
Some on St. Louis' governing board to call for public vote on stadium funding THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   5:05   5:05   
People: 
Missouri (724) 
ST. LOUIS — St. Louis residents still may get to vote on city funding for a new riverfront football stadium if some on the city's governing board get their way. 
The St. Louis Post-Dispatch ( http://bit.ly/1jD4Txj ) reports several members of the St. Louis Board of Aldermen on Friday are to introduce a measure that require a public vote before allowing the city to spend roughly $150 million on the billion-dollar stadium. 
Mayor Francis Slay's office cautions such a bill could kill plans for the new stadium. 
The move comes two months after a St. Louis judge declared as invalid an existing city ordinance requiring a public vote. 
It's still unclear if St. Louis will have an NFL team when the stadium is finished. Rams owner Stan Kroenke is seeking to move to Los Angeles.
